newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London Evening Standard - Nov 19.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London Evening Standard - Nov 19.

text.p: Prepared for Reuters by The Broadcast Monitoring Company

A fire which began aboard a freight train in the Channel Tunnel has proved to be the worst accident in its two year old history. Fifteen Britons were amongst the 34 passengers and crew who fled the heat and toxic fumes which began on a lorry aboard Le Shuttle between Calais and Folkestone.
REBEL STIRS UP BID BATTLE FOR NORTHERN

Today Northern Electric faced a new challenge in its battle against a hostile takeover bid from American CalEnergy . U.S. investor Guy Wyser-Pratte is urging management at Northern Electric to discuss the offer and is trying to muster support from other shareholders.
EUROTUNNEL FACES BIG FERRY BILL AFTER FIRE

Following the fire last night, Eurotunnel in a reciprocal arrangement with P&O is diverting thousands of its customers onto its Cross channel ferries. Eurotunnel says it will consider individual compensation payments.
JITTERS OVER TANKAN UNNERVE THE YEN
The yen fell against the dollar, amidst speculation that Japan's quarterly survey of business feeling will indicate a disappointing economic performance.

Impetus caused by the financial crisis at Lloyd's of the past few years has forced the organisation to open its doors to outside investment. Businesses supervising the underwriting of insurance at Lloyd's are creating new business partnerships, in what was once a area dominated by influential families.
